title: True Liberation Eludes Kherson as Russian Shelling Intensifies in Ukraine
description: Months after Ukrainian forces pushed out Russian occupiers, the city of Kherson remains very much a war zone.

title: The Black Sea Is a Crucial Theater in the War Between Russia and Ukraine
description: Long dominated by Russia’s navy, the Black Sea has been the scene of Ukrainian defiance. It’s also been a rare point of agreement between the two countries.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: A Downed U.S. Drone
description: Also, U.S. markets seem to stabilize and Xi Jinping tightens his control over China’s economy.

title: Cyclone Freddy Brings Mudslides and Floods, Leaving Nearly 200 Dead in Malawi
description: The record-breaking storm barreled across southeastern Africa into landlocked Malawi, where rescue workers searched for survivors as rain kept falling.

title: Polish Court Convicts Rights Activist of Aiding an Abortion by Providing Pills
description: It was the first conviction of its type in the country and in Europe, offering a glimpse of the implications of a near-total ban on abortion.

title: Who Was Leonardo’s Mother? A Novelist Has Evidence She Was Enslaved.
description: An author has a theory that the artist’s mother, Caterina, was kidnapped as a girl in Caucasus area of Central Asia.

title: The U.S. Program That Brought H.I.V. Treatment to 20 Million People
description: Over two decades, Pepfar may have saved an estimated 25 million lives, helping to slow the AIDS pandemic.

title: Biden Administration to Restrict PFAS Levels in Drinking Water
description: The government will strictly limit in drinking water two chemicals that are ubiquitous in modern society but are linked to a range of health effects.

title: An Oil Rush Threatens Natural Splendors Across East Africa
description: A multibillion-dollar oil drilling and pipeline project is displacing thousands of people in Uganda and Tanzania, and ravaging pristine habitats. Environmentalists are fighting to stop it, but the governments are all in.

title: This Dress Survived for More Than Three Centuries at the Bottom of the Sea
description: Divers found an almost perfectly preserved dress in the remains of a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 1600s. Researchers are trying to figure out who owned the garment.

title: Prigozhin, Head of Wagner, Plots Political Advance in Russia
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin says his Wagner force will shrink when the battle for the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut is done. Now he’s maneuvering on the home front, for the favor of President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Jiang Yanyong, Who Helped Expose China’s SARS Crisis, Dies at 91
description: A retired military surgeon, he blew the whistle in 2003 on Beijing’s cover-up of the epidemic. He was later punished for denouncing the Tiananmen Square crackdown.

title: Gary Glitter Is Back in Prison After Violating Probation Terms
description: The singer was released from prison last month after serving half of a 16-year sentence for sexually abusing three young girls decades ago.

title: Russia Bombards Frontline Areas in Southern Ukraine
description: Moscow pounded towns in the Kherson region, Ukrainian officials said, in a possible sign that it is trying to disrupt Ukraine’s plans for a counteroffensive. Here’s what we are covering:

title: The Bank Failures, Explained
description: Officials are worried that a few banks’ collapse is only the beginning.

title: Macron Faces Pivotal Week in His Attempt to Change France at Its Core
description: Millions are again expected to protest President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to raise the retirement age before a decisive vote that could redefine his nation and his legacy.

title: Flood of Russians Alter Life for Countries That Took Them In
description: Russians, fleeing their country and its war, have quickly reshaped the societies of nations like Georgia and Armenia.

title: To Rein in China’s Banks, Xi Uses Familiar Playbook
description: Xi Jinping is revamping China’s regulatory framework so the ruling Communist Party can assert more direct control over financial policy.

title: Biden Extends Stay for Thousands of Ukrainians
description: One-year extensions for those who fled in the first months after Russia’s invasion will be granted on a case-by-case basis, officials said.

title: Cyclone Freddy Persists, Leaving Dozens More Dead in Africa, Red Cross Says
description: A storm that has broken records for its longevity — now 35 days — swept inland from the southeastern coast of Africa and is causing massive flooding and displacement.
